s.text: Instead they mean to suggest, with self-respecting reticence, the idea of a strong but adaptable order in things.
Such exposure may not always be flattering, but it does let the voter sense the man behind the slogan.
Images of him with his tailored arms across the shoulders of other leaders seem reflections of genuine impulse, all the more poignant in the context of sober modern dress.
Images of him with his tailored arms across the shoulders of other leaders seem reflections of genuine impulse, all the more poignant in the context of sober modern dress.

Images of him with his tailored arms across the shoulders of other leaders seem reflections of genuine impulse, all the more poignant in the context of sober modern dress.
Lincoln sits forever in his monument, his marble words glowing high up on the walls behind him and beside him.

Washington and Jefferson in their antique knee pants can't hope to compete; neither can Teddy Roosevelt in his boots and gun, nor Reagan in his cowboy outfit, nor, frankly, Dole and Clinton in their exercise clothes.

Washington and Jefferson in their antique knee pants can't hope to compete; neither can Teddy Roosevelt in his boots and gun, nor Reagan in his cowboy outfit, nor, frankly, Dole and Clinton in their exercise clothes.

Washington and Jefferson in their antique knee pants can't hope to compete; neither can Teddy Roosevelt in his boots and gun, nor Reagan in his cowboy outfit, nor, frankly, Dole and Clinton in their exercise clothes.

Washington and Jefferson in their antique knee pants can't hope to compete; neither can Teddy Roosevelt in his boots and gun, nor Reagan in his cowboy outfit, nor, frankly, Dole and Clinton in their exercise clothes.

And for once, the candidates look like heads of state before they've even taken office, clad in the same somber outfit as Prime Minister Netanyahu, Boris Yeltsin, or President Karimor of Uzbekistan--a very dark suit, a pure white shirt with starched spread or pointed collar, and a tie with a generous but disciplined pattern.

Just the careful hair of each (unconvincingly dark for Dole, unconvincingly gray for Clinton), the contrasting hair of their running mates (soberly dark for Gore, youthfully gray for Kemp), and similar suits on all the very different bodies.
In American life, a dark suit is a given; it is a costume generated out of modern man's honorable and heroic past, particularly his political past.

Just the careful hair of each (unconvincingly dark for Dole, unconvincingly gray for Clinton), the contrasting hair of their running mates (soberly dark for Gore, youthfully gray for Kemp), and similar suits on all the very different bodies.
Bill, Bob, Al, and Jack are more visible in their smooth, dark envelopes than they are in the multicolored, bunchy stuff required for golf or hiking, picnics or beaches.
